results.deck: MicroProse Software, Inc. was a North American game company founded by Sid Meier and Bill Stealey in 1982.
results.description:
Timeline

  • 1982: MicroProse is founded by Bill Stealey and Sid Meier.
  • 1993: MicroProse is acquired by Spectrum HoloByte.
  • 1994: Bill Stealey departes and founds Interactive Magic.
  • 1996: Sid Meier and Jeff Briggs departes and founds Firaxis Games.
  • 1998: MicroProse is acquired for $70 million in cash by Hasbro and merged with Hasbro Interactive.
  • 2001: MicroProse ceased to exist after publisher InfogramesEntertainment SA (IESA) acquired Hasbro Interactive.

The MicroProse brand is currently used by a company named Microprose Systems LLC.
results.name: MicroProse Ltd.

game.name: Inside Trader: The Authentic Stock Trading Game
